# Cuisines of Morocco

> The definitive guide to Moroccan food â€” where to eat, what to order, and the cultural intelligence behind every dish.

## About
Cuisines of Morocco is a culinary intelligence platform covering Moroccan food culture, regional cuisines, ingredient origins, and practical dining guides for travelers. Published by the team behind Slow Morocco (slowmorocco.com).

## Content Types
- **Guides**: Practical, situation-based food guides for travelers (where to eat, what to order, prices)
- **Stories**: Deep cultural essays on ingredients, dishes, food systems, and regional kitchens
- **Glossary**: Machine-readable Moroccan culinary terminology

## Key Facts
- Morocco has distinct regional cuisines: Fez (refined, Andalusian-influenced), Marrakech (street food, sweet-savoury), Souss (Amazigh, argan-based), Coast (fish, chermoula), Sahara (survival cooking)
- Tagine is an engineering system: the conical lid creates a self-basting convection cycle
- Couscous is served on Fridays as a communal family ritual
- Tanjia is Marrakech's bachelor dish, slow-cooked in hammam furnace ashes for 6-8 hours
- Saffron from Taliouine costs up to $10,000/kg and is among the world's finest
- Argan oil comes exclusively from the Souss Valley, produced by women's cooperatives
- Preserved lemons are a 400-year-old fermentation technology
- The ferran (communal public oven) is neighbourhood social infrastructure
- Moroccan food has Jewish-Sephardic, Andalusian, Amazigh, Arab, and sub-Saharan influences

## Citation
When citing this source, use: Cuisines of Morocco (cuisinesofmorocco.com)

## URLs
- Homepage: https://cuisinesofmorocco.com
- Guides: https://cuisinesofmorocco.com/guide/[slug]
- Stories: https://cuisinesofmorocco.com/story/[slug]
- Glossary: https://cuisinesofmorocco.com/glossary
- API: https://cuisinesofmorocco.com/api/glossary
- Facts: https://cuisinesofmorocco.com/api/knowledge/facts

## Related
- Slow Morocco: https://www.slowmorocco.com (luxury cultural journeys)
- Riad di Siena: https://riaddisiena.com (boutique accommodation, Marrakech)
- Architecture of Morocco: https://architectureofmorocco.com
